Key Match Events: Ravindra Jadeja took three crucial wickets to turn the match from 110/2 to 119/5 in the space of 16 balls
Post-Match Reflections: Ravindra Jadeja identified the turning point of the match as the wicket of Steve Smith, stating it was not easy to rotate the strike for the new batter afterwards
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia had made a strong start with David Warner and Steve Smith laying the foundation for a competitive total
Others: Ravindra Jadeja's spell only conceded 28 runs for three wickets and was crucial to India's victory
India's spinners took six wickets to turn the match
